Line 83: Line 83:
''PlayOnLinux'' is an application to ease the installation of Windows games using Wine. It uses an online database of scripts to apply to different games that need special configurations and if the game is not in the database, a manual installation can be performed. Aside from games, any other programs can also be installed and each one is put in a different container (WINEPREFIX) to prevent interference of one program in another and provide isolation, the same way that [[CrossOver Office]]'s bottles work.<ref>[http://www.playonlinux.com/en Play on Linux]</ref>
''PlayOnLinux'' is an application to ease the installation of Windows games using Wine. It uses an online database of scripts to apply to different games that need special configurations and if the game is not in the database, a manual installation can be performed. Aside from games, any other programs can also be installed and each one is put in a different container (WINEPREFIX) to prevent interference of one program in another and provide isolation, the same way that [[CrossOver Office]]'s bottles work.<ref>[http://www.playonlinux.com/en Play on Linux]</ref>

''[[VMware ThinApp]]'' can easily package windows applications (making so called "portable apps"), these applications can then be easily run on Linux, since they require no installation. <ref>
